#summary The rel="shortcut icon" attribute indicates that the referenced document is an icon for the current document.
#labels about-html,is-html-attribute,from-microsoft

`rel="shortcut icon"` is one of several [LinkTypes link types] for describing relationships between documents.

Shortcut icons are also frequently called "favicons", due to [BrowserFamilyMSIE Internet Explorer]'s [http://bitworking.org/news/No_Fishing annoying habit] of requesting the `/favicon.ico` file at the root of a domain.

== Usage ==

Most browsers display the linked icon in the location bar next to the URL of the current document, and in the bookmarks menu.

== Elements ==

You can use the `rel="shortcut icon"` attribute on these elements:

  * [LinkElement <link>]

== Browser compatibility ==

|| *Test* || *IE8* || *IE7* || *FF3* || *FF2* || *Saf3* ||
